{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3543827,"name":"Micah","username":"micahL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/micahl/{size}/240235_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T22:23:36.605Z","cooked":"

Hi! My electrical team just finished wiring the mechanisms on our robot, and there‚Äôs an error with the pigeon 2.0. It‚Äôs blinking red, which means that there is ‚Äúno valid CAN‚Äù. A team member said it might be a roborio issue, but the roborio can connect to the driver station just fine, so I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs right. We don‚Äôt know how to fix this, does anyone have any ideas?

How is your wiring configured?
Did you terminate the end of your CAN loop = do you have the 120 ohm resistor at the end of the CAN loop?
If you don‚Äôt, then the CAN wire would only be able to reach a foot or two.

Also a picture of your wiring would be nice.
